intro: Cirsium kagamontanum, commonly known as the Kagamontan thistle, is a perennial plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple or pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a rosette growth form with a thick, fibrous root system. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
